_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This document has been prepared to demonstrate how SSI Foods - Amarillo complies with the requirements set forth under EPA's Chemical Accidental Prevention Provisions (40 CFR Part 68).  

 

This plan has been developed specifically to address the requirements applicable to the use of anhydrous ammonia at SSI Foods - Amarillo located in Amarillo, TX. Each of the following sections provides a general overview of the requirements and defines the design attributes, documentation, and actions that are established to comply with those requirements.  In most instances, SSI Foods - Amarillo has already developed measures and systems that provide compliance with 40 CFR Part 68 rules as a result of other regulatory programs and requirements.  This document does not replicate that information but rather provides cross-references to the applicable existing documentation.  In those instances where information was developed specifically to comply with the Part 68 requirements, that information is contained in this document.

 

1.1.     Corporate Commitment to Safety

 

SSI Foods - Amarillo is committed in providing to all employees a work environment that is free from recognized health and safety hazards.  Accordingly, our goal is achieving and sustaining safety through communication, information, and training.  To this end, we are dedicated to the concept that all employees receive the proper orientation and are provided with the means necessary to ensure the environment remains as safe and healthful as possible.

 

1.1.1.     It is the policy of SSI Foods - Amarillo to:

 

1.1.1.1    Provide safe working conditions, proper tools, and personal protective equipment.

 

1.1.1.2     Comply with all federal, state, and local occupational health, safety, and environmental laws and regulations.

 

1.1.1.3    Provide and sustain a high level of commitment to ensure all employees have a safe and healthy work environment in which to work.

 

1.1.1.4     Ensure, through training, and when necessary

disciplinary action, that all employees work in a safe manner.

 

1.1.1.5    Educate and/or train all employees in safe work practices, and ensure that each employee fully understands his or her job, equipment, techniques, and methods to reduce the risk to himself or herself and their co-workers.

 

1.1.2.    Encourage all employees to "Think Safety", so that safety habits developed and practiced at work carry through to non-work related activities.

 

1.1.3.    SSI Foods - Amarillo's aim is to provide a professional service as efficiently as possible while minimizing the use of toxic materials wherever and whenever prudent.  In this effort, our highest priority will be the proactive pursuit of cost-effective process changes that reduce or eliminate the use and/or generation of hazardous toxics at the endpoint of service.  Where hazardous toxics cannot be eliminated, improving controls to handle these substances will be explored and implemented wherever possible.

 

1.1.4.    SSI Foods - Amarillo has prepared a facility safety policy and procedures program specifically tailored for the facility. In addition, a Process Safety Management Program has also been established and implemented regarding the ammonia refrigeration system process.  It is the responsibility of the designated facility personnel to carry out these programs.

 

1.1.5.    The first duty of SSI Foods - Amarillo employees is to exercise care in the performance of his/her work tasks to prevent an accident to him/herself, co-workers, the general public or equipment.  Safety-consciousness must take precedence over expedience, and is required as a condition of continued employment of all employees at all levels of the organization.

 

1.2.    SSI Foods - Amarillo Facility Description



 Facility description and regulated substances handle: 



SSI Foods is a domestic producer of processed food products. The SSI Foods - Amarillo, TX plant site covers approximately 90,000 square feet within the Amarillo, TX city limi

ts. It is located at 10171 Axiom Drive, Amarillo, TX, 79108, Potter County.  The facility employees approximately 110 personnel.  The facility uses Anhydrous Ammonia in the "Refrigeration System".



 Accidental release program & chemical-specific prevention steps

1.2.1.    The substance regulated under the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions (40 CFR 68) that is located on site, in various locations and quantities is anhydrous ammonia.

 

1.2.2.    Anhydrous ammonia is utilized on site for the "Refrigeration System." The Operating Inventory is 39,300 pounds of ammonia used as a refrigerant in the facility's system based on actual measured charge of ammonia on the system's initial charge.  The ammonia is contained in various vessels, piping, condensers and evaporators used throughout the ammonia refrigeration system.  

 

1.3.    Worst Case Release Scenario

 

1.3.1.    Considering that a "catastrophic" possibility does exist; the facility modeled two off site consequence analyses; a worst case and alternate case scenario.

 

1.3.2.    For both scenarios, EPA's RMP Comp was used to determine the facility Off-Site Consequence Analysis.  The distances to the toxic endpoints for both releases, and the potential impacts are discussed in Section 3.0. Releases are represented on the maps in Appendix B of this document.

 

1.4.    Emergency Response Program

 

1.4.1.    SSI Foods - Amarillo is equipped with an emergency information system.  Evacuation plans are placed throughout the facility to inform personnel in an emergency relating to the accidental release of ammonia, or other emergencies that may be encountered.  There are specific procedures that all employees must follow in the event of release; which can be found in the SSI Foods - Amarillo Emergency Action Plan.  These procedures include evacuation of personnel, notification of authorities and actions to be taken to stop, or mitigate the emergency if it is safe to do so.

 

1.4.2.    Plant personnel have received required eme

rgency training as outlined in OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.38 & 29 CFR 1910.120.

 

1.4.3.    The Amarillo Fire Department has visited the facility to review the process operations, safety systems and discussed emergency response coordination.
